intro: Ranunculus auricomus var. dissectus, commonly known as the dissected buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with deeply lobed petals that give it a lacy appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
